Fly hence!  be gone!  heart-wringing Care</br>And Discontent — a gloomy pair!</br>Drag with you all the past year's pain,</br>And every ill that crowd your train;</br>For laughing Mirth and honest Cheer,</br>Shall welcome in the new-born year.

Welcome to our festive board,</br>Trusty brothers of the sword!</br>Welcome all your social band,</br>Faithful guardians of the land,</br>Asserters of Britannia's right,</br>Renown'd for war and martial fight.

The neigh'bring field your valour shows,</br>Where Macintoshes — hardy foes!</br>Lie buried in distinguish'd heaps:</br>Still o'er these sons Britannia weeps,</br>Lamenting virtue so disgrac'd,</br>And gallant spirit so misplac'd.</br>Within the isle then peace restor'd,</br>Your aid the German powers implor'd:</br>At Lafeldt soon you shewed the foe,</br>What prowess could with conduct do;</br>The General, conscious 'twas your due,</br>By public thanks distinguish'd you:</br>Minden, upon the rolls of Fame,</br>Gives you a great and glorious name,</br>Where, on a plain extended wide,</br>Out-number'd far on ev'ry side,</br>You taught the world what Valour cou'd,</br>Arm'd in the cause of Public Good,</br>Effect—

—Six corps alone the battle gain'd,</br>And Vic'try to the British standard chain'd,</br>Gallantly forc'd her from a num'rous throng,</br>Who counted full an hundred thousand strong.</br>The future times will wonder at the fact,</br>And scarce believe it was an human act:</br>The plains of Minden, Sparta must agree,</br>Surpasses e'en her fam'd Thermopylae.

Let these great acts for ever be</br>Deep rooted in your memory,</br>And ever present to your view,</br>To virtue rouse and stim'late you,</br>That when again, on war's alarm,</br>Your country claims your 'vengeful arm,</br>Th' implanted sense of former fame,</br>May give new lustre to your name,</br>And teach the world this glorious truth,</br>That, train'd to war, the British youth,</br>With patriotic zeal inspir'd,</br>Their breasts with love of glory fir'd,</br>All nations on the earth excell,</br>Are matchless and invincible.

Thus shall your country's annals boast your corps,</br>And, glorious thought!  in ages hence,</br>Some valiant chief to stimulate the more</br>And urge his troops, the battle in suspence,</br>Shall hold your great example to their view,</br>And owe his wreath of victory to you:</br>This influence will your living virtue have,</br>And thus you'll serve your country in the grave.</br>
